description: From Scottish Gaelic grealach (“entrails”), from Proto-Celtic *gre-lach, from Proto-Indo-European *ǵʰer- (“bowels”).

entries.meaning: (Scotland, rare) The entrails or offal of a dead deer.

verbs.description: gralloch (third-person singular simple present grallochs, present participle gralloching, simple past and past participle gralloched)
